comment: Very nice and sweet. One of the most wonderful professors at KSU. definately would take her again.

She is by far the best foreign language professor I have had at KSU. She engages the class and really cares about teaching German. That said, as long as you put in the work and try your best, you should enjoy the class as well as learn a lot!

I thought she was tough to begin with as my previous teacher was very lax. I came into this class not knowing much, but left learning a lot. Didn't do well on a test or two, but if you study you'll be fine. Gives a lot of extra credit and work to help pad your grade. Made an A in the class and didn't work hard at all. Just do your work
She's super sweet. Just do all the work and it's easy.
Very friendly woman, tries to keep class exciting and students involved. Fairly lenient with grades as long as you try.

Easy class and very nice lady. Always willing to help and explain things. Was very, very understanding in the struggles of learning a new language and was always encouraging. Made class a lot of fun too.
Great intro to German class. Sometimes she is a bit hard to understand. She isn't always completely clear, but she is sweet and kind. She has a great sense of humor. It was a very fun class.
